results.title: Vision at night
results.creator_credit: Science Films and Great Britain. Royal Air Force
results.brief_description: The structure of the eye, and its operation, especially at night: visual purple; rods and cones; scanning; adaptation; pre-adaptation; goggles; the value of special diet for night vision.

results.title: Visibility and protective clothing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycling”
Examines the problems many motorists have in seeing motorcyclists, due to poor visibility from cars. Demonstrates the importance of protective clothing, the selection of the correct helmet, footgear, and gloves. Some riders talk about their accidents and injuries they have received.

results.title: Visages de femmes = Faces of women
results.creator_credit: Films de la Lagune and Desire Ecare
results.brief_description: Twelve years in the making, “Visages de Femmes” is a wonderfully unpredictable and creative look at the financial, sexual and emotional emancipation of African women. The film is a series of episodes linked by a chorus featuring traditional singing and dancing. Ecare’s achievement is to create a visual feast which owes little to colonial models of cinema.

results.title: Viruses: threshold of life
results.brief_description: With the aid of complex instruments such as the ultra-centrifuge and the electron microscope, the use of tissue cultures and animal experimentation, we see how scientists in a modern virology laboratory explore the nature of viruses, how these viruses exist and how we can use this knowledge to improve our health and well-being.

results.title: Viridiana
results.creator_credit: Uninci, Films 59, Gustavo Alatriste, Ricardo Munoz Suay and Luis Bunuel
results.brief_description: A novice about to take her vows, who has been abused and cheated by her uncle and his illegitimate son, opens up the former’s house to a collection of cripples and beggars. A savage attack on Catholic mentality and rituals, this powerful psychological study was Bunuel’s first film made in his native Spain for over twenty-five years and his last for many more. Although the script had been unaccountably passed by Franco’s censors, the film itself was banned outright in Spain. The notorious set-piece of ‘The Last Supper’ being enacted by social outcasts also caused the Vatican to condemn it. Cast includes Silvia Pinal, Fernando Rey and Francisco Rabal. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Virginia Woolf: the moment whole (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: National Educational Television, Janet Sternburg and Alan Raymond
results.brief_description: Introduces the philosophy and literary style of the 20th century writer, Virginia Woolf, by presenting visuals of the milieu in which she worked complemented by selections from “A room of one’s own” and “The waves”, read and portrayed by Marian Seldes.

results.title: Virginia Woolf's criticism of the novel 'Life escapes'
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Open University and Richard Callanan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The 19th Century Novel”.
Following a dramatised scene from Virginia Woolf’s novel “Life Escapes”, Professor Arnold Kettle argues that Virginia Woolf was not just telling a story but recreating an era of reality and this leads her to break with the traditional form of the novel in a way which emphasises the moment-to-moment impressions of life.

results.title: Virginia Woolf
results.brief_description: In this documentary, that examines the life and times of Virginia Woolf, the viewer is given a unique insight into the environment and social background that shaped her attitudes and feelings, and which inspired her creative thought.
